item.title: Hello R Markdown by HT
item.description: Hello Test – image: unordered list item 2 sub-item 1 sub-item 2 ordered list item 2 sub-item 1 sub-item 2 ordered list sub-item? sub-item2? Embed Code Two plus two equals 4. Here’s some code 1 dim(iris) ## [1] 150 5 Here’s some code 2 dim(iris) Here’s some code 3 ## [1] 150 5 Test gif image test 2 for (i in 1:10) plot(runif(100), ylim = c(0, 1)) # for example library(purrr) library(ggplot2) library(repurrrsive) # for the example data below gap_split_small <- gap_split[1:10] countries <- names(gap_split_small) # For all countries plots <- map2(gap_split_small, countries, ~ ggplot(.

item.title: Rmd test 01
item.description: R code test test codes of ggplot and dplyr packages. so far, they are working. library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union sum <- Orange %>% group_by(Tree) %>% summarise( age_m = mean(age), circum_m = mean(circumference), n = n() ) print(sum) ## # A tibble: 5 × 4 ## Tree age_m circum_m n ## <ord> <dbl> <dbl> <int> ## 1 3 922.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
